intro: Sebastiania ditassoides var. discolor, commonly known as the variegated sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with shades of green, white, and yellow. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by orange or red capsules. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique leaf patterns and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. The varietal name 'discolor' refers to its distinct coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties within the species.
